title: Biden administration to roll out cybersecurity steps as president meets with CEOs from Silicon Valley, other sectors
text:
There will be specific commitments and concrete steps, the administration official told reporters on Tuesday, without giving details.

The participating chief executives are expected to include Apple's AAPL Tim Cook, Microsoft's MSFT Satya Nadella and Amazon's AMZN Andy Jassy, who took over last month from Jeff Bezos. Alphabet's GOOGGOOGL Google, IBM IBM, ADP ADP, JPMorgan Chase JPM, Bank of America BAC, TIAA, U.S. Bancorp USB, ConocoPhillips COP, Duke Energy DUK, PG&E PCG, Southern Co. SO, Williams WMB and Travelers TRV also are expected be among the companies with CEOs taking part.

Washington is trying to respond to an ongoing barrage of cyberattacks. This year has brought high-profile incidents such as the Colonial Pipeline ransomware attack that led to gasoline RBU1 shortages in the Southeast, and the massive SolarWinds SWI hack that affected the networks of multiple government agencies and corporations.

Now read:Can Biden really protect Americans from the next crippling cyberattack?

After the president's discussion with the CEOs, the executives and some educators are due to take part in separate meetings with other administration officials, covering “Critical Infrastructure Resilience,” as well as “Building Enduring Cybersecurity” and the “Cybersecurity Workforce.” 

U.S. stocksSPX were little changed Wednesday.
